00025 #ifndef SYX_TYPES_H
00026 #define SYX_TYPES_H

00028 #include "syx-config.h"
00029 #include "syx-enums.h"
00030 #include "syx-platform.h"
00031 
00032 #include <limits.h>
00033 #ifdef HAVE_STDINT_H
00034 #include <stdint.h>
00035 #endif
00036 #include <wchar.h>
00037 
00038 #include <stdio.h>
00039 #include <stdlib.h>
00040 #include <string.h>

00042 SYX_BEGIN_DECLS
00043 
00048 #define SYX_IS_POINTER(oop) ((oop) && ((oop) & 3) == SYX_TYPE_POINTER)
00049 #define SYX_IS_SMALL_INTEGER(oop) (((oop) & 1) == SYX_TYPE_SMALL_INTEGER)
00050 #define SYX_IS_CHARACTER(oop) (((oop) & 3) == SYX_TYPE_CHARACTER)
00051 
00052 #define SYX_OOP_EQ(oop1, oop2) ((oop1) == (oop2))
00053 #define SYX_OOP_NE(oop1, oop2) ((oop1) != (oop2))
00054 
00055 #define SYX_POINTERS_OFFSET(top, base) ((syx_int32)(((syx_nint)(top) - (syx_nint)(base))/sizeof (syx_pointer)))
00056 
00058 #define SYX_OOP_CAST_POINTER(oop) ((syx_pointer) (oop))
00059 
00060 #define SYX_POINTER_CAST_OOP(ptr) ((SyxOop) (ptr))
00061 
00063 #define SYX_SMALL_INTEGER_CAN_EMBED(num) ((num) >= (-1 << 30) && (num) < (1 << 30))
00064 
00065 #define SYX_SMALL_INTEGER_SUM_OVERFLOW(a,b) (((a ^ b) | (((a ^ (~(a ^ b) & (1 << (sizeof(syx_int32) * CHAR_BIT - 1)))) + b) ^ b)) >= 0)
00066 
00067 #define SYX_SMALL_INTEGER_DIFF_OVERFLOW(a,b) (((a ^ b) & (((a ^ ((a ^ b) & (1 << (sizeof(syx_int32) * CHAR_BIT - 1)))) - b) ^ b)) < 0)
00068 
00069 #define SYX_SMALL_INTEGER_DIV_OVERFLOW(a,b) ((b == 0) || ((a == INT_MIN) && (b == -1)))
00070 
00071 #define SYX_SMALL_INTEGER_EMBED(num) ((syx_int32)(num) & ~(3 << 30))
00072 
00073 #if !defined FALSE || !defined TRUE
00074 #define FALSE 0
00075 #define TRUE 1
00076 #endif
00077 
00078 typedef unsigned char syx_bool;
00079 
00080 typedef char syx_char;
00081 typedef unsigned char syx_uchar;
00082 
00083 typedef wchar_t syx_wchar;
00084 
00085 
00086 typedef syx_char * syx_string;
00087 typedef const syx_char * syx_symbol;
00088 typedef syx_wchar * syx_wstring;
00089 typedef const syx_wchar * syx_wsymbol;
00090 
00091 #ifdef HAVE_STDINT_H
00092   typedef int8_t syx_int8;
00093   typedef uint8_t syx_uint8;
00094   
00095   typedef int16_t syx_int16;
00096   typedef uint16_t syx_uint16;
00097   
00098   typedef int32_t syx_int32;
00099   typedef uint32_t syx_uint32;
00100   
00101   #ifdef HAVE_INT64_T
00102     typedef int64_t syx_int64;
00103     typedef uint64_t syx_uint64;
00104   #endif
00105 #else
00106   #ifdef _MSC_VER
00107     typedef signed char syx_int8;
00108     typedef unsigned char syx_uint8;
00109     
00110     typedef short syx_int16;
00111     typedef unsigned short syx_uint16;
00112     /* Note: this might not be true for 64-bit compilers */
00113     typedef int syx_int32;
00114     typedef unsigned int syx_uint32;
00115 
00116     typedef _int64 syx_int64;
00117     typedef unsigned _int64 syx_uint64;
00118   #else
00119    #error "don't know how to define types for this compiler"
00120   #endif
00121 #endif
00122 
00123 typedef long syx_nint;
00124 typedef unsigned long syx_unint;
00125 
00126 typedef long syx_size;
00127 typedef syx_int32 syx_varsize;
00128 
00129 typedef float syx_float;
00130 typedef double syx_double;
00131 
00132 typedef void * syx_pointer;
00133 
00134 typedef syx_nint SyxOop;
00135 
00136 /* Basic instance types */
00137 
00139 #define syx_boolean_new(cond) ((cond) ? syx_true : syx_false)
00140 
00141 #define syx_small_integer_new(num) (((SyxOop)(num) << 1) + SYX_TYPE_SMALL_INTEGER)
00142 
00143 #define syx_character_new(ch) (((SyxOop)(ch) << 2) + SYX_TYPE_CHARACTER)
00144 
00146 #define SYX_SMALL_INTEGER(oop) ((syx_int32)(oop) >> 1)
00147 
00148 #define SYX_CHARACTER(oop) ((syx_uchar)((oop) >> 2))
00149 
00150 
00152 extern EXPORT syx_bool SYX_SMALL_INTEGER_MUL_OVERFLOW (syx_int32 a, syx_int32 b);
00154 extern EXPORT syx_bool SYX_SMALL_INTEGER_SHIFT_OVERFLOW (syx_int32 a, syx_int32 b);

00158 #define syx_free free
00159 
00160 
00161 INLINE syx_pointer
00162 syx_malloc (syx_int32 size)
00163 {
00164   syx_pointer ptr;
00165 
00166   if (!size)
00167     return NULL;
00168 
00169   ptr = malloc (size);
00170   if (!ptr)
00171     {
00172       puts ("out of memory\n");
00173       exit (-1);
00174     }
00175 
00176   return ptr;
00177 }
00178 
00179 INLINE syx_pointer
00180 syx_malloc0 (syx_int32 size)
00181 {
00182   syx_pointer ptr;
00183 
00184   if (!size)
00185     return NULL;
00186 
00187   ptr = malloc (size);
00188   if (!ptr)
00189     {
00190       puts ("out of memory\n");
00191       exit (-1);
00192     }
00193 
00194   memset (ptr, '\0', size);
00195   return ptr;
00196 }
00197 
00198 INLINE syx_pointer
00199 syx_calloc (syx_int32 elements, syx_int32 element_size)
00200 {
00201   syx_pointer ptr;
00202 
00203   if (!elements || !element_size)
00204     return NULL;
00205 
00206   ptr = calloc (elements, element_size);
00207   if (!ptr)
00208     {
00209       puts ("out of memory\n");
00210       exit (-1);
00211     }
00212 
00213   return ptr;
00214 }
00215 
00216 INLINE syx_pointer
00217 syx_realloc (syx_pointer ptr, syx_int32 size)
00218 {
00219   syx_pointer nptr;
00220 
00221   nptr = realloc (ptr, size);
00222   if (!nptr)
00223     {
00224       puts ("out of memory\n");
00225       exit (-1);
00226     }
00227 
00228   return nptr;
00229 }
00230 
00232 INLINE syx_pointer
00233 syx_memdup (syx_pointer ptr, syx_int32 elements, syx_int32 element_size)
00234 {
00235   syx_pointer nptr;
00236 
00237   nptr = syx_malloc (element_size * elements);
00238   memcpy (nptr, ptr, element_size * elements);
00239 
00240   return nptr;
00241 }
00242 
00243 
00244 INLINE syx_string
00245 syx_strndup (syx_symbol src, syx_size n)
00246 {
00247   syx_string ret = (syx_string) syx_malloc (n + 1);
00248   memcpy (ret, src, n);
00249   ret[n] = '\0';
00250   return ret;
00251 }
00252 
00253 INLINE syx_string
00254 syx_strdup (syx_symbol src)
00255 {
00256   return syx_strndup (src, strlen (src));
00257 }
00258 
00259 SYX_END_DECLS
00260 
00261 #endif /* SYX_TYPES_H */
